record.dc:title: 469AN19 Cox Mound, Anderson County, Tennessee. Burials 1AN8, 1AN9, 1AN10.
record.wpa:narrative: [Burial 8] This burial was seemingly disarranged by another burial. The head was considerably higher than the other bones which were not wholly in anatomical order, but enough to exclude any bundle reburial. [Burial 9] Two clay bowls 11" to the north from burial and somewhat lower level (approximately 3" below body). Five inches to the west of remains a smooth, flat limestone 6" in diameter. [Burial 10] Clay below remains showed evidence of mesh. Slight traces of bark above and below the remains. Three limestone hoes and one bear jaw - associated.
record.wpa:comments: Direction South. Photograph 470AN19 is similar to this one, just taken from a different direction. Both photographs are recorded on the same three burial data forms. Field specimens #6 and #7 listed on burial data form as: pots. Field specimens #8 and #9 listed as: hoes.
